body: There isn't such list. It is dynamic and driven by many fectors.
Use a local es, and init skywalking again.
So, are you trying to say, the shards of segment indexes are not balanced by the ElasticSearch cluster automatically?

elasticsearch defalut balanced shards on cluster level.
so some case: one node have 20 metrics shards and 10 records shards. another has 20 record shards and 10 Metrics shards.

at cluster level. all nodes is balanced.
but in node level. not balance
i think the effect on ES is too much metrics shards.The amount of data is not a problem for ES.the problem is create to many small shards in elasticsearch

So basically, this is caused by the size of the metrics set is much smaller than the size of the trace dataset. Right? If so, I would like to ask you, consider to enhance `StorageModuleElasticsearchConfig#dayStep`.

```java
    /**
     * Since 6.4.0, the index of metrics and traces data in minute/hour/month precision are organized in days. ES
     * storage creates new indexes in every day.
     *
     * @since 7.0.0 dayStep represents how many days a single one index represents. Default is 1, meaning no difference
     * with previous versions. But if there isn't much traffic for single one day, user could set the step larger to
     * reduce the number of indexes, and keep the TTL longer.
     */
    @Getter
    private int dayStep = 1;
```

According to your case, we should add a new config for `dayStepForRecord`, which default is `-1`, meaning disabled. Then the codes still use `dayStep = 1`.
But to resolve your issue, you could set `dayStep = 7`(or more) and `dayStepForRecord = 1`, then the number of index(es) and shards decrease clearly. Then the ElasticSearch LB mechanism should be back to work again.

@EvanLjp If you like this, we should forward this change to the mail list before we change the codes(PR).

FYI @apache/skywalking-committers WDYT?
@wu-sheng it's a good feature. This is the same idea as @SuperDataset

Yes, it is quite similar. Actually, that is why we need `Record` and `Metrics` for the first time. We just aren't sure how difference they will be. More use cases drive us to provide more reasonable configurations, with good explanations about why we need them, and how we use them.
Please send a mail to the mail list, with your issues and recommended solutions. Also, notice, the images are not working there. Try to use texts and static URLs provided by GitHub.
ok

@EvanLjp BTW, I think you should write an optimization blog about how to use these configurations in the production environment one day. This would be helpful for many people, who don't understand the source codes very well.
no problem
It is working on my side. Check your network.
We supported this in the 8.1.0 release. @krmeda Could we work on a blog to post on the Spring website? Or how should we update the micrometer website?
CLI subproject has been created and released for a long time.
Go agent has been working well.
@jason8888888 We have better solution about the profiling. The number of threads has been watched in the 8.1.0 release.

Resolved by https://github.com/apache/skywalking-python/pull/59

At the kafka consumer end, it cannot be tracing with ` user code`. See this [FAQ:kafka-plugin](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/FAQ/kafka-plugin.md) for details. As for the hook method, it wants to be compatible with traces that did not receive or have no data before, because the consumer's logic is always while true

Because that is your private TCP level protocol, there is no header we could inject. So, wouldn't be any plugin for all TCP communication. But, at the same time, as you should know your protocol, you could build a plugin for your own.

Your test case fails.

It doesn't block technically, but if someone finds out, for example, we don't have package name defined in each of our *.proto. Probably they will raise their eyebrows. The package declaration in the .proto file is the namespace used by the protobuf language. The recommended name pattern will be something like `package company_name.project_name`. As an example, the well-known types are defined in the `google.protobuf` namespace. The lack of a package declaration means that all declarations in your *.proto file are in the top-level global namespace, which seems very highly prone to namespace conflicts. The "new set of APIs"  plan above eases the pain if we want to make the linter happy, while we still have the "current" version generates compatible code.

However, in the end, It's up to you for sure, whether we want to follow a certain style-guide "approved" by the industry or not.

@vishvarodrigo

> You should make the codes detecting the JVM type automatically. And your codes include a lot try catch and reflection. Why do you write codes in this way?

Cause I don't want my code depends on oracle/sun jvm api (com.sun.management.OperatingSystemMXBean)  or ibm jvm api （com.ibm.lang.management.OperatingSystemMXBean）。
With reflection we support  oracle/sun and ibm jvm and maybe other jvm :)

> With reflection we support oracle/sun and ibm jvm and maybe other jvm

This is the thing which should be enhanced. You never need a config to activate this accessor. You could use the reflection too. If the target class(es)/method(s) found, then this could be activated. 
The current accessor should be the default. 

You should not use SPI(this word), there is no SPI. SPI is the JVM level mechanism.

> > With reflection we support oracle/sun and ibm jvm and maybe other jvm
> 
> This is the thing which should be enhanced. You never need a config to activate this accessor. You could use the reflection too. If the target class(es)/method(s) found, then this could be activated.
> The current accessor should be the default.
> 
> You should not use SPI(this word), there is no SPI. SPI is the JVM level mechanism.

只所以让实现类可配置是为了其可扩展性：有切入点可以不用直接核实代码而在官方不支持情况提供适配置或兼容处理。

SPI只是技术术语，并不仅限于JVM吧， 而应是反过来的： JVM提供了其SPI方式的扩展机制。我们也可以有其它方式的SPI。

SPI means Service Provider Infrastructure。目的是为了让服务或实现可替换。

If it's not satisfied for you , you may change the code :)

我提交PR目的是为了回馈开源社区， 但没空细究于此了： 按你们喜欢的方式改吧。怎么同时兼容oralce/sun和ibm jvm我已经提供样例，具体如何修改只是技术实现细节问题。

My point is, there is no need for config. You could use `class#forName` to determine whether this is IBM/SUN JDK or others.

The open-source community is welcome and looking forward to the feedback, but also, at the same time, the high quality of open source project is based on the review mechanism and making the codes as best as you can.
